arts.ttl: 'People will always say' - Arne Slot responds to Liverpool penalty decision at Bournemouth
arts.sum: Arne Slot was speaking after the Premier League match between Liverpool and Bournemouth at the Vitality Stadium

arts.ttl: 'Best midfield in the league' - Keown praises Liverpool trio
arts.sum: Match of the Day's Martin Keown says Liverpool's "outstanding" midfield trio is "the best in the Premier League" after their 2-0 win against Bournemouth.

arts.ttl: Remarkable Mo Salah > Raphinha & Lamine Yamal stat surfaces after Liverpool brace
arts.sum: A head-turning statistic, highlighting the ongoing excellence of Liverpool star Mohamed Salah across the season to date, has on Saturday come to the fore online. This comes after the Egyptian…

arts.ttl: Liverpool ratings: Salah shines to end Bournemouth's streak
arts.sum: Mohamed Salah impressed yet again for Liverpool as their 2-0 win over Bournemouth saw them extend their lead top of the Premier League to nine points.

arts.ttl: Liverpool star makes feelings clear on fans' most-wanted summer transfer target
arts.sum: Arne Slot and Liverpool have yet to dip into the transfer market in January but talk around one of their potential summer targets has got louder in recent weeks

arts.ttl: Virgil van Dijk sends Mo Salah contract message after making Premier League history
arts.sum: Mohamed Salah was the star of Liverpool's win agains Bournemouth and team-mate Virgil van Dijk has called upon the Egyptian to continue firing the Reds to success amid his expiring contract

arts.ttl: Liverpool suffer blow ahead of Carabao Cup second-leg against Spurs - with Reds star a major doubt for tie after suffering an injury in Bournemouth win
arts.sum: It came after Liverpool left Chiesa and Gomez out of their matchday squad despite the pair being fit, underlining the fact the Premier League leaders had a clean bill of health.

arts.ttl: Arne Slot credits ‘world-class’ Alisson and ‘a bit of luck’ in Bournemouth win
arts.athr: John Brewin at the Vitality Stadium
arts.sum: Home fans irate after Liverpool awarded first-half penalty Visiting goalkeeper makes vital saves to keep clean sheet “Having Mo Salah definitely helps,” said Arne Slot after the Premier League’s leading goalscorer notched twice at Bournemouth to stretch Liverpool’s lead in the title race as the Egyptian continued to write his name in the record books. A 2-0 win at the Vitality left Arsenal with a deficit of nine points to bridge. “If you want to win here, maybe you need a bit of luck as well, because the margins are so small,” said Slot. Andoni Iraola’s team had previously beaten Manchester City, Arsenal and, last week, Nottingham Forest 5-0 but Liverpool forged on where their rivals had slipped. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Liverpool overcome big Bournemouth hurdle to put spotlight on Arsenal
arts.sum: Where Arsenal, Nottingham Forest and Manchester City failed before them, a Mohamed Salah-inspired Liverpool prevailed, winning at AFC Bournemouth as Arne Slot's Reds went nine points clear at the top of the Premier League. Andoni Iraola's side had beaten the second, third and fourth-placed teams at home this season and were looking to complete the set on Saturday and dent their opponents' hopes of winning only a second-ever Premier League title.

arts.ttl: Hits & misses: Liverpool look unstoppable as Hurzeler shows his inexperience
arts.sum: Brighton found that out as Forest kept a 10th clean sheet of the season - the most of any team in the Premier League. The question of whether his side will win the Premier League in his first season in charge can surely no longer be up for debate.
